Krabi offers something for each traveler willing to go to the heavenly bliss with context to the Krabi Tour Packages and Krabi Honeymoon Packages. Whether you're a soul seeker or a fun-loving party quite traveler, Krabi will meet your expectations perfectly. Some destinations are ideal for holidays and then there are some that are meant just for vacations and getaways. For tourists who are headed to Krabi, there might be no better choice. this tiny town proves the adage ‘good things are available small packages’ right, because albeit it's small in terms of area, the opportunities that it offers for fun are near to limitless. Thus, Krabi tour packages are becoming popular with globetrotters. Sitting on the shores of the Andaman Sea , Krabi is a town that has such a lot to share that there's no chance that tourists would get bored here. From sandy beaches to glistening pools of fresh water, there's such a lot to experience here. 

There also are coral reefs stretching as far as the eye can see and caves tucked faraway from public attention. A tour package to Krabi lets tourists explore over 130 islands that comprise this a part of Thailand. a number of the more popular islands are Mu Koh Poda, Mu Koh Hong and Poda Island. Not only do these islands have great beaches, but also facilities that tourists would search for on a vacation .

Places to Explore at Krabi:

The beautiful province of Krabi in Thailand isn't only famous globally for its quaint beaches and blue waters; rather, it's some of the renowned sightseeing options which will be explored too. The Krabi Emerald Pool, Krabi park and Krabi Tiger Cave are those that witness thousands of tourists per annum and are a crucial a part of Krabi Tour Packages. apart from this, tourists can check out Ao Nang, Railay, Phi Phi Island and even Koh Lanta that are positioned at close proximity to Krabi.

Activities to be enjoyed at Krabi:

The best a part of visiting Krabi is that it provides ample opportunities for travelers to loves spending memorable moments of their life. Besides enjoying the exotic time on the beaches, one can try various amazing things to try to to in Krabi, one can explore hiking , island hopping, snorkeling, jungle trekking, sea kayaking, and skin diving . With such a spread of activities, the tourists can surely have the bliss to require pleasure in exploring Krabi from various spots. it's a group of picturesque beaches that makes it worthy of exploring its scintillating beauty. In fact, one can acquire training in scuba diving to observe underwater life.

Best Krabi Tour Packages

Krabi has a tropical monsoon climate and, thus, is visited by tourists all year long. The best time to visit Krabi is during the cool monsoon season, from November through March. The warm weather and the clear, sunny skies make this the prime time for enjoying the beaches, snorkeling, and diving.

 5 Places to Visit in Krabi That Can Be A Part Of Your Krabi Tour Package

Krabi is a very happening and lively town and there are many places to visit on your vacation in the city. Here are a few attractions that must-be visited while on your vacation in the city.

1. Railay Beaches and Caves

What’s Special: Lagoon caves, cliffs, beaches

 Nearby Attractions: Princess Cave, Diamond Cave, Sa Phra Nang hidden lagoon,

 Entry Fees: No entry fee

 Timings: 24 hours

 Distance From City Center: 18 km

 

Transportation Options: Long-tail boat

 Location: Ao Nang, Mueang Krabi District, Krabi 81000, Thailand

 A secluded beach in Thailand, Railay is situated in the city of Krabi. A beautiful seashore with tranquil white sand and clear seas, the Railay beaches, and caves are located in a small peninsula with large limestone cliffs, lagoons, caves, and viewpoints. Cut-off from main Krabi, the peninsula is covered with limestone headlands and deep jungle valleys. Railay beaches and caves are the perfect places for relaxing and rejuvenating in the calm and peaceful sands. All the lagoons, cliffs and caves are at a walking distance from here and so you can explore the whole of the island on your own.

 

2. Thung Teao Forest Natural Park

What’s Special: Nature, Wildlife

 Nearby Attractions: Ko Phi Phi, The Emerald Pool, Tiger Cave Temple

 Entry Fees: 100 baht for children and 200 baht for adults

 Timings: open every day during daylight hours

 Distance From City Center: Krabi Airport

 Transportation Options: Cab

 Location: Khao Pra-Bang Khram, near Bang Teao Village

 

A day amidst nature is worth every minute and Thung Teao Forest Natural Park will lend you a day amidst immense greenery and nature. If you are a nature lover, then this is the perfect place for you to spend some time with oneself. The multi-colored flowers, beautiful birds and majestic mountains will give a relaxing vibe to your day. Adventure lovers are advised to bring along a pair of binoculars and trekking gears and trek through the twists and turns of the park and get close to nature.

 

3. Wat Tham Sua

What’s Special: Intricate architecture

 Nearby Attractions: Wat Ban Tham, River Kwai Jetski Tours, Chungkai War Cemetery, Kanchanaburi War Cemetery, Wat Khun Thai Tha Ram Temple

 Entry Fees: No entry fee

 Timings: 8:00 Am to 5:00 Pm

 Built-In: 1975

 Distance From City Center: 5.5 km

 Transportation Options: Cab

 Location: 35 Krabi Noi, Mueang Krabi District, Krabi 81000, Thailand

 Covered with large trees, in the Khiriwong Valley, and mountains on all sides, you will also find small caves in great numbers. Wat Tham Sua is not only a site of a meditation center but also holds places of archeological and historical interest. Fine stone tools, pottery remains, and Buddha footprints have been found in the excavation. Located near Krabi town, the temple is also known as the Tiger Cave Temple and is one of the most interesting temple complexes in southern Thailand. Monks are believed to live and worship within a maze of natural caves and overgrown jungle valley here.

 

4. Krabi Town

What’s Special: Thai culture

 Nearby Attractions: Railay Beaches & Caves, Koh Poda, The Emerald Pool, Koh Hong, Wat Tham Sua

 Distance From City Center: 9 km

 Transportation Options: Cab

 

This market Thai town has a laid back vibe and is very local. The river in Krabi is the hub of all activity in the town. Fishing boats, river taxis ferrying and the surrounding beaches and islands make for a great holiday spot. The river is the hub of all activity and many hurry to these destinations like Ao Nang, Koh Lanta, Koh Phi Phi for roaming around the city. You will experience genuine Thai culture and hospitality. Sticking around Krabi town is a rewarding experience that you must not miss on.

 

5. Klong Thom Hot Springs

What’s Special: Hot water spring

 Nearby Attractions: Emerald Pool, Wat Khlong Thom Museum, Bor Namphut, Namtok Ron, Wareerak Hot Spring Spa

Timings: 7:00 A.m to 8:00 A.m, 4:00 Pm to 5:00 Pm

 Distance From City Center: 12 km

 Transportation Options: Cab

 Location: Huai Nam Khao, Khlong Thom District, Krabi 81120, Thailand

 One of the most serene places in Krabi is Marking. The Klong Thom Hot springs stretch all over and is the perfect spot for refreshing the mind and soul. You will feel completely close to nature and ideal surroundings with green and soothing environments. The hot spring and cool streams slope to form lovely cascades of warm water perfect for a bath with temperature around 40-50 degree Celsius. A visit to this Krabi natural hot spring is a must. There are many hallowed-out ‘bathtubs’ caused by the running water from the thermal springs. Take a dip into the hot springs and refresh each and every vertical of the the mind and soul.
